text: My name is Rene Heroux.

I'm the Chief Technology Officer of the Cloud
practice at Scalar Decisions.

And we are a national solution integrator
for AWS in Canada.

If I was to summarize the advantages of Scalar
to work with AWS, it's the best of breed services

and technology that Amazon's bringing to the
market that lets us help our customers actually

solve real business problems in a very, very
fast manner.

The partnership that stands out to me the
most with our customers, would probably be

the Toronto International Film Festival; so
TIFF, better known as.

They had an issue where their ticketing site
would constantly crash during ticketing event

days, which typically happens at the end of
August.

We helped them re-design that, with Auto Scaling
in mind, Elastic Load Balancing, and CDN services.

So, now, on day one, it never crashes and
the only complaints they're getting is being
sold out of tickets, which is a good thing.

The way I would define the government's move
to the cloud in the past five years would

be a slow one, but it's happening now and
it's happening for real.

Five years ago, if we were at a government
customer, cloud wouldn't even be on their
mind, but now it really is.

And it's due to many things; one of the primary
drivers is the Region that came to Canada
in late 2016, I believe.

So, that sort of, set the stage for them to actually
start using cloud in a meaningful way.

AI & ML specifically... Most companies aren't
going to be able to develop and deliver those
services themselves, on premise.

So, I think any customer that really
wants to dig their teeth into AI & ML are

going to have to use public cloud to make
that happen.
